page.title: 01POPULATION-an introduction
page.content: The area, consisting of Appley Bridge, Shevington Vale, Shevington Moor and Shevington, can best be described as a group of dormitory villages. Close to the motorway and the conurbations of Manchester, Preston and Liverpool, many residents travel some distance to work as there is virtually no local employment outside farming and the service industries. From the early 15th. century the land was owned and administered by the Standish family but in 1922, at the death without issue of the head of the family, it was sold by auction. The development of the area for residential purposes began then; the present population is in excess of 12000 and increases steadily. Legacies of the industrial past are being adapted to leisure uses.
